docs.abstract: You don’t have to like Amazon to fear Trump’s attack on it.
docs.snippet: You don’t have to like Amazon to fear Trump’s attack on it.
docs.lead_paragraph: In 2009, Turkey’s tax ministry imposed a $2.5 billion fine for alleged tax evasion on Dogan Yayin, a media conglomerate whose newspapers and television stations were critical of the Turkish leader Recep Tayyip Erdogan. Under financial and political pressure, the company began unloading some assets and closing others. Last month, the billionaire Aydin Dogan sold his remaining media properties, including the influential Hurriyet newspaper and CNN Turk, to a group of Erdogan loyalists.

docs.abstract: His administration has come down on opposite sides of arguments about whether to enact internet sales taxes.
docs.snippet: His administration has come down on opposite sides of arguments about whether to enact internet sales taxes.
docs.lead_paragraph: For months, the Trump administration has rightfully been trying to thwart attempts by some European governments to impose a new corporate “digital tax” on American high-tech giants. This campaign to block internet-inspired extraterritorial taxation — taxation of income earned outside of a jurisdiction — is strongly supported by the American business community. But the White House, in an odd twist that turns its European Union digital tax arguments upside down, just argued before the Supreme Court that the same kind of extraterritorial taxation is acceptable when carried out by American states on retail sales on the internet.

headline.main: Is Trump’s Tax Incoherence Just a Way to Hurt Amazon?

docs.abstract: It’s not just sports franchises: Tax incentives to lure companies tend to help politicians, but they don’t really make economic sense.
docs.snippet: It’s not just sports franchises: Tax incentives to lure companies tend to help politicians, but they don’t really make economic sense.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Near the bottom of the lengthy ballot San Francisco voters considered this week, in this state famous for its abundant and oddball ballot initiatives, Proposition I asked voters to establish a policy of not coveting other cities’ sports teams.

headline.main: Why Cities Can’t Stop Poaching From One Another
headline.print_headline: Why Cities Can’t Stop One-Upping One Another

docs.abstract: The streaming service looks to add to its slate of original programming with the Oscar-winning writer and director of “Get Out.”
docs.snippet: The streaming service looks to add to its slate of original programming with the Oscar-winning writer and director of “Get Out.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Jordan Peele, the writer and director of the hit film “Get Out,” has signed a deal giving Amazon the first look at his ideas for television series, the company said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Jordan Peele Signs TV Deal With Amazon
headline.print_headline: Peele and Amazon Strike First-Look Deal

docs.abstract: The justices heard arguments about whether to overrule a 1992 decision that shielded many internet retailers from having to collect sales taxes.
docs.snippet: The justices heard arguments about whether to overrule a 1992 decision that shielded many internet retailers from having to collect sales taxes.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A closely divided Supreme Court struggled on Tuesday to decide whether internet retailers should have to collect sales taxes in states where they have no physical presence.

headline.main: Supreme Court Divided on Sales Taxes for Online Purchases
headline.print_headline: Sales Taxes For Internet Split Court

docs.abstract: The company is said to be in talks to acquire Flipkart, India’s leading online retailer, to counter Amazon’s push into the country.
docs.snippet: The company is said to be in talks to acquire Flipkart, India’s leading online retailer, to counter Amazon’s push into the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: Walmart is nearing a deal to acquire a majority stake in India’s leading online retailer, a bold move that would open another front in its escalating war with Amazon.

headline.main: Walmart, With Billions to Spend, Seeks Flipkart E-Commerce Site in India
headline.print_headline: Walmart Nears Deal to Control Indian Online Store Flipkart

byline.original: By Vindu Goel, Michael J. de la Merced and Michael Corkery
